for...js-for-loops.jsonOf Loop - get length of each word. Return a number "array"
prob_hints: The for...of loop is a more modern and concise way to iterate over the elements of an array. It's particularly useful when you don't need to know the index of the current element.

prob_instructions: For Loop - add 5 to each number in the **numbers array**. Return an **array** with new values
prob_hints: The traditional for loop is useful when you know the exact number of iterations you need to perform. It's straightforward and easy to understand.

prob_instructions: For loop. Take the values in **numbers array** and add them up. Return sum result.
Use For loop - Finds the largest number in an array of **numbers**.
return: The largest number in the array.
Counts the occurrences of each character in a given **string**.
return: An object where each key is a unique character found in the input string, and each value is the count of that character.
ForEach Loop - Converts all **words** in an array to uppercase.
return: An array of strings where all characters are converted to uppercase.
prob_hints: The forEach method is a higher-order function provided by JavaScript arrays. It executes a provided function once for each array element. It's a good choice when you want to perform an operation on each element of the array without needing to know the index.

prob_instructions: map Loop - Adds ten to each number in an array.
return: An array of numbers where each number has been increased by ten.
try not to use an extra array as a bucket
prob_hints: it returns a NEW array -  It's a higher-order function that takes a callback function as an argument and returns a new array.
The map method creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the array. It's useful when you want to transform the elements of an array.

prob_instructions: filter Loop - get words that start with "top". return array
do not use an extra array as a bucket
prob_hints: The filter method creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function. It's useful for filtering out elements based on a condition.

prob_instructions: filter Loop -  Filters an array of inventors to return only those who lived between the years 1500 and 1599.
return: An array of inventor objects who lived between the years 1500 and 1599.
prob_hints: The filter method creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function. It's useful for filtering out elements based on a condition.

data.prob_problem:
function reduceLoop(numbers) {    return numbers.reduce((acc, curVal) => acc + curVal, 101);
}
prob_instructions: reduce Loop - sum all array **numbers**, but start with 101 in the bucket. return result
Result: The sum of the accumulator (initially 101) and all numbers in the array.
prob_hints:
Syntax: array.reduce(callback(accumulator, currentValue[, index[, array]])[, initialValue]);
            array.reduce((acc, curValue) => acc + num, 0);

The reduce method applies a function against an accumulator and each element in the array (from left to right) to reduce it to a single output value. It's useful for accumulating values or transforming the array into a single value.

prob_instructions: Get the even numbers from the reduce Loop - sum all array numbers, but start with 101 in the bucket. return result
do not use an extra array as a bucket
Triples each number in an array.
Result:  An array of numbers where each number has been multiplied by three.

data.prob_problem:
function sumNumbers(numbers) {    return numbers.reduce((acc, curVal) => acc + curVal);

}
prob_instructions: Sums up all numbers in an array.
return: The sum of all numbers in the array.
do not use an extra array as a bucket
prob_hints:
Syntax: array.reduce(callback(accumulator, currentValue[, index[, array]])[, initialValue]);
            array.reduce((acc, curValue) => acc + num, 0);

prob_instructions: Calculates the sum of all even numbers in an array, after tripling each of them.
Result: The sum of all tripled even numbers in the array.
do not use an extra array as a bucket
prob_hints:
Syntax: array.reduce(callback(accumulator, currentValue[, index[, array]])[, initialValue]);
            array.reduce((acc, curValue) => acc + num, 0);
